Bash(git -C "c:\\Users\\dimsh\\Downloads\\Pong-test" commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
v3.17.5 - Polish Two-Team Gameplay & Fix Critical Bugs

Display Fixes:
- Fix duplicate QR codes on initial waiting screen
  * Generate persistentQR only when switching to lobby/game screens
  * Store QR data globally, create on-demand with generatePersistentQR\(\)
  * Only large waitingQRCode visible on waiting screen

Ship Combat Fixes \(CRITICAL\):
- Shield now properly blocks 100% of bullet damage
  * Added shield.active reset at frame start \(line 2930\)
  * Shield only active when player actively holds it
  * Previously shield stayed active after player released control
  * Bullets now correctly deflected or blocked by active shields

Attacking Engine Booster Fixes:
- Reduced fire rate: 1000ms cooldown \(1 shot/sec, was 10 shots/sec\)
- Bullets now orange \(#FFA500\) matching engine flame color
- Bullets fly in SAME direction as engine thrust/flame particles
- Increased max distance: 500px \(was 300px\) to fly farther
- Custom bullet.color property rendered in display.html \(lines 2405-2412\)

UX Improvements:
- Loot messages now visible for 2 seconds \(was 1 second\)
  * Doubled lifetime in spawnScoreAnimation\(\) for better readability
  * Players can now read loot pickup messages

Control Range Extension:
- Rudder, WeaponDirection, Shield extended to -30% to 130% rotation
  * Formula: \(tilt * 1.6 - 0.3\) * 360 gives range -108¬∞ to 468¬∞
  * Allows more precise control and smoother wraparound
  * Engine and Weapon keep 0-100% range \(unchanged\)

ü§ñ Generated with [Claude Code]\(https://claude.com/claude-code\)

Co-Authored-By: Claude Sonnet 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")

Bash(git -C "c:\\Users\\dimsh\\Downloads\\Pong-test" commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
Fix duplicate QR and correct extended range logic

QR Code Fix:
- Explicitly clear and hide persistentQRDisplay on waiting screen
- Ensure only large waitingQRCode visible after ''Start Game''
- Added innerHTML clear and display:none before showScreen\(''waiting''\)

Extended Range Fix \(CRITICAL\):
- Previous implementation was WRONG - compressed calibrated range
- NEW: Allow 30% overflow beyond calibrated min/max values
- motionController.js: Changed clamp from [0, 1] to [-0.3, 1.3]
- Users can now tilt beyond calibration points by 30% in each direction
- Server-side: Reverted to simple tilt * 360 \(tilt already in extended range\)
- Applies to Rudder, WeaponDirection, Shield only
- Engine and Weapon remain 0-1 range \(unchanged\)

Technical Details:
- motionController.js line 89: Math.max\(-0.3, Math.min\(1.3, normalized\)\)
- Calibrated range \(e.g. 20¬∞-80¬∞\) = 0-1, but allows -0.3 to 1.3
- -0.3 = 30% below min, 1.3 = 30% above max
- Gives smoother wraparound and extended precision control

ü§ñ Generated with [Claude Code]\(https://claude.com/claude-code\)

Co-Authored-By: Claude Sonnet 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")

     QRCode library appends multiple elements without clearing

3. –ö–æ–Ω—Ç—Ä–æ–ª–ª–µ—Ä-–ò–≥—Ä–∞ Buttons Fix \(CRITICAL\):
   - Root cause: Race condition in gameState updates
     * Buttons shown for Ship game \(line 1239-1240\)
     * BUT then hidden in else block \(line 1308-1309\)
     * If gameState.gameType temporarily undefined ‚Üí buttons hidden
   - Solution: Removed automatic hiding in else block
     * Buttons start as display:none in HTML
     * Only SHOW for Ship games, never hide
     * Prevents race condition from hiding buttons
   - Buttons now ALWAYS visible for Ship game players

Bash(git -C "c:\\Users\\dimsh\\Downloads\\Pong-test" commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF'' Fix duplicate QR codes on –î–∏—Å–ø–ª–µ–π-–û–∂–∏–¥–∞–Ω–∏–µ \(4th attempt - final fix\) Root Cause Analysis: - QRCode library creates TWO DOM elements per call: * \(hidden, used for rendering\) * \(visible, converted from canvas data\) - Seeing 2 QR codes = new QRCode\(\) called TWICE - room_created WebSocket event fires multiple times OR code block executes twice due to race condition Solution Implemented: 1. Added window.waitingQRGenerated flag \(lines 1340, 1375, 1383\) - Check flag before generating QR - Set flag after generation - Skip generation if already done with console warning 2. Reset flag when leaving –î–∏—Å–ø–ª–µ–π-–û–∂–∏–¥–∞–Ω–∏–µ screen: - Reset in showScreen\(''lobby''\) - line 1183 - Reset in showScreen\(''game''\) - line 1201 - Reset in showScreen\(''win''\) - line 1197 - Allows fresh generation for next game session Why Previous Attempts Failed: - Attempt 1: Removed persistentQR generation \(wrong element\) - Attempt 2: Added explicit hide \(timing issue\) - Attempt 3: Added waitingQRGenerated flag BUT removed it later - Attempt 4: This fix - re-implemented flag with proper resets Debug Logging Added: - "üîç Before cleanup - child count: X" - "üßπ After cleanup - child count: X" - "‚úÖ Waiting QR code generated - child count: X" - "‚ö†Ô∏è Waiting QR already generated, skipping duplicate generation" Diagnostic data from user confirmed root cause: - Inspected DOM showed 1 canvas + 1 img per QR - 2 visible QRs = 2 canvas + 2 img elements - Proved new QRCode\(\) was being called twice Bump version to 3.17.6 ü§ñ Generated with [Claude Code]\(https://claude.com/claude-code\) Co-Authored-By: Claude Sonnet 4.5 EOF \)")

Bash(git -C "c:\\Users\\dimsh\\Downloads\\Pong-test" commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
Optimize for 10+ players: throttle + buffer limits

Performance Optimizations:
1. Throttle WebSocket broadcasts to 30 FPS \(server.js:2282-2298\)
   - Game loop still runs at 60 FPS for physics accuracy
   - Broadcasts only send every 33ms \(30 FPS\)
   - Reduces network traffic by 50% for 10+ player rooms
   - Adds ~16ms latency but prevents connection overload

2. Increase WebSocket buffer limits \(server.js:57-62\)
   - maxPayload: 100MB \(prevent message size errors\)
   - perMessageDeflate: false \(better performance, less CPU\)
   - Prevents buffer overflow with many simultaneous clients

Expected Results:
- Fewer disconnects/crashes with 10 players
- Lower bandwidth usage \(60 ‚Üí 30 updates/sec\)
- Minimal impact on gameplay responsiveness
- More stable connections under high load

Bump version to 3.17.8

ü§ñ Generated with [Claude Code]\(https://claude.com/claude-code\)

Co-Authored-By: Claude Sonnet 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")

Add multi-display support - join existing game

Client \(display.html\):
- Added mode selection UI on connection screen
- "Create new game" vs "Join existing game" buttons
- Input field for entering room code to join
- Modified WebSocket connection flow:
  * Show mode selection after connecting
  * Send create_room or join_room based on user choice
- Added room_joined message handler:
  * Receives current game state
  * Shows appropriate screen \(waiting/lobby/game\)
  * No QR code generation for spectator displays

Server \(server.js\):
- Added join_room handler \(lines 1817-1843\)
- Validates room exists before joining
- Sends room_joined response with:
  * roomId, gameType, current gameState
- Marks WebSocket as display \(ws.isDisplay = true\)
- Allows multiple displays to observe same game

Use Cases:
- Multiple projectors showing same game
- Spectator screens at events
- Backup display in case primary fails

How to use:
1. First display: Create game normally
2. Second display: 
   - Click "–ü–æ–¥–∫–ª—é—á–∏—Ç—å—Å—è –∫ —Å—É—â–µ—Å—Ç–≤—É—é—â–µ–π –∏–≥—Ä–µ"
   - Enter room code \(e.g., "ABC123"\)
   - Click "–ü–æ–¥–∫–ª—é—á–∏—Ç—å—Å—è"
3. Both displays now show same game state

Add "–°—Ç—Ä–µ–ª–∫–∞" control scheme for Snake with arrow indicator

New control scheme "arrow_steering" implements absolute steering 
\(like Ship''s rudder\) where phone tilt directly maps to snake direction.

Server Changes \(server.js\):
- Added arrow_steering case in updateSnake\(\) \(line 2428-2448\)
  * Tilt \(0-1\) ‚Üí targetAngle \(0-2œÄ radians\)
  * Smooth interpolation to target \(15% per frame\)
  * Shortest path rotation with angle normalization
- Initialize targetAngle on player creation \(line 1781\)
- Initialize targetAngle on respawn \(line 1912\)
- Transmit targetAngle & controlScheme to clients \(line 2282-2283\)

Client Changes \(display.html\):
- Added "–°—Ç—Ä–µ–ª–∫–∞" option to control scheme dropdown \(line 1038\)
- Arrow rendering logic after snake head \(line 2215-2259\)
  * Semi-transparent arrow \(opacity 0.5\)
  * Positioned 2.5 segments ahead of head
  * Points to target direction \(from tilt\), not current direction
  * Arrow color matches snake color
  * Only renders for players using arrow_steering

Features:
- Absolute direction control \(tilt angle = snake direction\)
- Visual indicator shows target direction
- Smooth interpolation prevents jarring snaps
- Per-player control scheme support
- Compatible with all existing modes

Technical Details:
- Interpolation factor: 0.15 \(tunable for responsiveness\)
- Arrow distance: 2.5 √ó segmentSize
- Arrow length: 1.5 √ó segmentSize
- Tilt range clamped to [0, 1] for stability

Bash(git commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
Add debug logging for arrow visibility investigation \(v3.19.2\)

Problem: Arrow not visible for arrow_steering/arrow_instant modes
despite correct control implementation.

Debug Changes:
1. Made arrow EXTREMELY visible for testing:
   - Color: Red \(#FF0000\) instead of player color
   - Opacity: 100% instead of 60%
   - Line width: 8px instead of 4px
   - Arrow length: 3.0√ó segmentSize \(was 2.0√ó\)
   - Arrowhead size: 1.2√ó segmentSize \(was 0.8√ó\)

2. Added console logging to diagnose root cause:
   - "üéØ Arrow drawn" - when arrow renders successfully
     * Logs: player name, targetAngle, controlScheme
   - "‚ö†Ô∏è Arrow NOT drawn" - when condition matches but fails
     * Helps identify if targetAngle is undefined
   - If no logs appear ‚Üí condition not being met at all

Expected Test Results:
- If red arrow visible ‚Üí rendering works, restore normal styling
- If üéØ logs but no arrow ‚Üí canvas/context issue
- If ‚ö†Ô∏è logs ‚Üí targetAngle not transmitted from server
- If no logs ‚Üí controlScheme not being set correctly

Root Cause Hypotheses:
1. targetAngle not transmitted in game state broadcast
2. controlScheme not persisted after player selects it
3. Arrow rendering code never executes \(unreachable\)
4. Canvas rendering happens but arrow off-screen/clipped

Next Steps After User Testing:
- User should check console for üéØ or ‚ö†Ô∏è messages
- User should report if they see giant red arrow
- Based on logs, we''ll identify exact failure point

Bump version to 3.19.2

ü§ñ Generated with [Claude Code]\(https://claude.com/claude-code\)

Co-Authored-By: Claude Sonnet 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")
